meanings.definition: To hinder or prevent the progress or accomplishment of something.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain was stymieing our picnic plans.
meanings.sent2: The closed road stymied our journey to the beach.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stymied our attempts to set up the tent.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog stymied our view of the beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent5: The tangled wires stymied our efforts to fix the broken lamp.

meanings.definition: To block or thwart someone's efforts or plans.
meanings.sent1: The locked door stymied our escape from the room.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected delay stymied their chances of catching the train.
meanings.sent3: The clever prankster stymied our surprise party preparations.
meanings.sent4: The strict rules stymied their rebellious intentions.
meanings.sent5: The confusing directions stymied our search for the hidden treasure.
